document.title: South Dakota State Standards for English Language Arts & Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects

640DBAE492704DE7862C54B0A94E3A16.description: Use vocabulary acquired through conversations, reading, and learning experiences, to ask questions and convey ideas.

55D5BC49925243C0BDA29BD7E4D69629.description: Distinguish between verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

0C9B30EAC8C541F6B0B1B559EE9651C4.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use

782D1949E6154B068C7CCCD37FCA0D06.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

E47117CC31C447E0AF8584C33E637C74.description: Sort common objects into categories to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

337FC3BBC25E411FA0C6C1F92817A501.description: With prompting and support, explore word relationships and subtle differences in word meanings.

08C6D3C86E5F4863AB90279F455B8CCC.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

58A1CDA2FB784E8EA946724D6994B869.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

3A2AE1EE4C924F2F9B350CCB3C4CF03A.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

9FE22B2A4C6149E68BCCAC78BC4E0232.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

F0A5CD64F3814E39964D035098956F43.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

E2102D77B8F940B4BF58509458C18B26.description: With prompting and support, capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

1DD0312F134041AD97649038FDDF724A.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

75B70F8DAF0547118209E43FF30FFFEF.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

05D9C6F602144797AE0107ABA961E5C3.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions

365BABBAE7AD47ECB4830E92203E4781.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/

27E6944DEB964D289E54A795D304B039.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

8B5450A5F059433F9285C7E0148A3D72.description: Print all uppercase (capital) and lowercase letters of the alphabet using correct formation.

FE442A89E2CC47A2B1D6B95D08EF2DFB.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

B098702F924E4986B804951F48F588EF.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

673E5DF74F6948E4B3F48903A7E618B4.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

85CA7A0C1EDD4945BD8F9B421611B392.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

50A8AE777B044433B027B50EAF814F71.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

3FD093430AA647AA9F83EEF60434DDF9.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

1E3DD8488E024A878D988B2414B60EFD.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

5FBE3CB5EDB84C8998FE48249BC931E2.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

BF30A7A2DF454E0688C2F6220C59C1D5.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

F206DA9BDAFD444294FDF9C551861D60.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to provide additional detail.

D653C18ECFBF4005B02CD8D482686A21.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events. With prompting and support, provide additional detail.

6CCFA13E8CDA4E2DB5B921F49DAFDDC5.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

0C79946C582142B2B3C948EC2CECFDCE.description: Confirm understanding from a source of information by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

8EA55120709D49EE9DB296C9F3073431.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

01B70CBD9E2E49B4B713C9E7A665850C.description: Participate in collaborative conversations about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

C625E6A46D5D48568F817F56B809114D.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

AED73A9A1BC5439F87C25F09873D62B7.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

CD530193C4C948999B50015FF371822C.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

3097A106F992424AB583BA8156688407.description: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

8490B51F14E640489848D7BDD0325DC6.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

54BC0CBB232544C98B57526921DC9AEB.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

9E8021B8E89440E99B8169D634638470.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

0991134F8336446EB122DF6D5BBD7DEF.description: With guidance and support provide a response to a question using a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing by recalling information from experiences or gathering information from provided sources.

05142649F40D403D9A79789B6BCC4DD0.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects.

723917D59F964EB1BBB431C0E0CD13A2.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

41C543F39B29497BADF1C374EEE5F911.description: With guidance and support, individually and collaboratively explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing.

0FD950998509447BBA4538ED93EEF47C.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing.

DCF96963D7B34D5086A69994F4179AAB.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

114F23F9EA034C0493C9777F06B09E0E.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

DED8334753F24212857BAD984EB382D3.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book.

5FADDA58BF804DA88A8670B505E60912.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

6D371F60A8F84562AB7DC9F1050816B7.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

2F68D8B9F46D4D7A877D30A01DCADB4B.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

16AD43496C664F73BDA96706117A56AF.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

7CF23205685442FA9FA6DBE035875A47.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

5DBA27EDC15C488C9F3E70A536DBF6B0.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

AA123D8E1E2F4C3FB27D898F4D656E3C.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

F3F557A1A87642588455760C8786D731.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, propose, and audience.

A7D5AA51215F4F07953824E00C059961.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, ad well-structured event sequences.

7C1E621F50E343FA95BC5BEFD01B2799.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

9DA0715479F04D4FAFD2CF1EA52DD841.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

04E6174D2DA24870B0E4508160C2C047.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

44FBD9ED50774322A450D97ACD81E053.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

32F4958B1DAB4440B9D320EAE7D91A83.description: Read grade-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and prosody (stress, phrasing, intonation and expression) on consecutive readings.

7430E8A3D0004D5CBA8A2EEC925C42C4.description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

CF0ADF35943B4A538D6C1BF34E048C20.description: Read emergent-reader texts with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

54D5A57DB50A4F7BB62F73F597D06105.description: Read grade-level appropriate high-frequency words by sight.

E7FDBF9EE23A402284AB8D998F4F84B5.description: Associate the long and short sounds for the five vowels.

561C00A0ECFA4306B443ECFEDB6A649B.description: Demonstrate one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary sound for each consonant.

E40862788A80416FA322771C272C8ABB.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

AF3FDAC3A7024005B52DFD7EE389AE79.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme words (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) to make new words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x.

96DACE48811341BD9B8C3AFBA59ACCA6.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

8C809C7D86174675BB015B6916C087BD.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

671FAE19D86C48C0BA4AFE7629268F2C.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

BB4E629784E64606A2B45D1A232F069B.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

5FAC07398B184829A6E5011964791B46.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

348A1FA4D8F0476C9B890D386C0D3D41.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet. e. Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

89004D334B1045FD8C1EC5AAB50A5937.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

5B96F698350B4A3E89533BAAF53BBFFA.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

E7A93E0B1E7F4B8F95446C55A8D1A9C8.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

59824BEBAB7B45C7B397C1E53C587D87.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

97D3EE41A4244A5EBAC2F1BD73CC5772.description: With prompting and support, self-select texts for personal enjoyment, interest, and academic tasks.

6873C120AAE141A5857078C17A9664EB.description: With prompting and support, read and comprehend proficiently at grade level with increasing challenge in text difficultly and complexity (e.g., layout, text structure, language/literary features, knowledge demands.)

3372D64D99494B12A713026AEFFA427E.description: By the end of the year read and comprehends a variety of informational text.

2BB9B41F04A240D1A258C943BDE22537.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

BC276C27DF544B05AF6BD2A2536EF0B1.description: With prompting and support compare and contrast two texts on the same topic (similarities and differences).

0AE22B045AFF4F6A819C09ED1D881D25.description: With prompting and support, identify the details/evidence an author gives to support points in a text.

151F9B6C149344829B5029E71E3EA4F5.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in an informational text.

3E65E26C058D490282B8B0EB6AA2C2FF.description: Identify the author and illustrator and define the role of each in an informational text.

232C485711FE4AFE8CC34D3472C29CC4.description: With prompting and support, know and use various text features.

F4BD040E719F4DCABA82DE3371BB4630.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

63C48BE675E6451398618C7795EEE5D8.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

45576B5392614F19952828523CE81EA4.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

EFD603BDB92449D7AB975AF5DE27AB3A.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

B5F6755361934486B0551747C7E7DB7D.description: With prompting and support, self-select texts for personal enjoyment, interest, and academic tasks.

3AC118F5EB1D416388F474D4B39C5A74.description: With prompting and support, read and comprehend proficiently at grade level with increasing challenge in text difficultly and complexity (e.g., layout, text structure, language/literary features, knowledge demands.)

0F0283CD975346E59C943E88993C6B49.description: By the end of the year read and comprehend a variety of literary text.

C258A3B862944200ACE6A0C587FBA284.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

62252BD6409541B8B5BCD731A610B091.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

0D164F4FF39F408799C93F154E3A2D37.description: With prompting and support, explain the relationship between illustrations and the text.

0FE2349DA0624579917D23935B0EAE74.description: Identify the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in a literary text.

ACD915A5990A430E93CC006FFF895D4B.description: With prompting and support, explain differences between common types of texts.

104807A85FC9474E9C241D72554437B6.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in stories, poems, nursery rhymes, or songs.

8CE151EDE09B4F87BA63D058BF934130.description: With prompting and support, describe characters, settings, and major events in a story.

99D975CF198A470D915A18C02E7416D2.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

1D9A3B56DDFE41788A4828EA286A6D47.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

8CB2BEF75A534FA280D7B9B161D06538.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

833A3290F74E495A9344CEB595E38555.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

C818B7F2F99F4F138818B096B66C575D.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

97D84F3906A64E0FB678F22DD6F34450.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

BBC599F6A9224EE2AAF44438E1DB1ACC.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

A07EE704D1B44C2EA0F88FF83B43B1AC.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

3A6DA60EFD844E54BA91F1A7FA58B24D.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

84B101977FE8405B80EE5949CA690C77.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

BB9905B914234F3BBC2FF03CB3F069DE.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

0AAA43A3F19E484B8096DE15AEC1A1C7.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

546890D3403948C99BFA72B0AC2F6D6D.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

5D2E7D1A914C4F098238C118218894A9.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
